page.title: 14ENTON HALL CLINIC
page.content: { Enton Hall}was originally built for the Coates family in 1880. Then Lady Chichester moved in when the Coates family left,but then it was turned into a Health Clinic.In the centre there is a swimming pool,used by the clients.They have 50 acres of land and a local farmer rents half the land to graze cattle on. They also have twenty six chalets in which people stay while having treatment.People come from all over the world to be treated.The 'House Rules'state a vegetarian diet will be taken and you are not allowed to smoke in the Clinic except in the smoking room.During the week they have lectures in the lecture room.They have a bar serving health drinks in the evenings.The fee for accommodation,food and treatment, including the services of your own doctor,is Â£900 for two weeks in 1985.
